about.short: Arceon AI is a SaaS platform that extracts data from PDFs/images using OpenAI, validates it with rules, routes uncertain cases to reviewers, and keeps full audit trails for claims teams.
about.long:
Arceon AI removes the manual grind of reading claims documents. The platform ingests files, converts them into structured data, applies policy checks, flags anomalies, and hands reviewers a guided queue for anything that needs human judgment.

It blends AI extraction with a Django/DRF backend, role-based access, and audit logs so enterprises get faster decisions without losing control or traceability.

objectives: Automate structured data extraction from unstructured documents.
Cut claim processing time with AI + rules + human-in-the-loop review.
Stay compliance-ready through audit logs, RBAC, and change history.

document_ingestion: Upload portal with batch and API/email ingest options.
Supports PDF and image inputs with versioning.
Re-processing flow when better data is needed.
ai_extraction: LLM-driven field extraction with confidence scoring.
Template-free prompts with structured JSON output.
Normalization for dates, amounts, and codes.
validation_and_rules: Configurable checks for required fields and thresholds.
human_review_queue: Side-by-side doc viewer with editable fields.
Actions to approve, reject, escalate, or request info.
claims_workflow: Status pipeline from New to Approved/Rejected.
Assignments, SLAs, and timers for throughput.
audit_and_compliance: Full audit trail for every change and decision.
Who/when/what tracking for system and users.
analytics_and_reporting: Volumes, approval/review rates, and turnaround times.
Top failure reasons and rule-trigger frequency.
Dashboards by team, client, or department.

core: Ingest documents in bulk and extract fields via AI.
Apply rules for validation and routing.
Human-in-the-loop review UI with audit logs.
enterprise_ready: RBAC with roles for admin, supervisor, reviewer, viewer.
API keys, webhooks, and configurable retention policies (planned).
security: TLS in transit and secure storage with access controls.
Token-based authentication with rate limiting and logging.
Session and request auditing for compliance.

backend: Django and Django REST Framework (DRF) for APIs.
PostgreSQL with Redis/Celery for queues and caching.
ai: OpenAI API for extraction and classification.
Prompt templates with structured outputs and fallbacks.
Batching/caching to control cost and latency.
frontend: Responsive reviewer UI with document viewer and field mapping.
devops: Dockerized services with CI/CD for deploys.
Observability via logs and metrics for the pipeline.

discovery_and_requirements.summary: Mapped core document types, workflows, and compliance needs.

ux_and_prototyping.summary: Designed ingestion, reviewer experience, dashboards, and audit views.

backend_and_pipeline_build.summary: Built APIs, models, extraction service, and rules engine foundation.

initial_launch.summary: Limited release with ingestion, extraction, validation, and review flows.

v1_hardening.summary: Improved accuracy, audit logs, RBAC, analytics, and error handling.

ongoing.summary: Advanced rule builder, integrations, and scalability improvements.

budget.notes: Equivalent value for extraction pipeline, review UI, rules, security, and deployment; costs are mainly engineering, infra, and OpenAI usage.

challenges: Extraction accuracy varies across layouts and scan quality.
Decisions must be explainable and auditable for compliance.
Rule engine needs to flex across industries without heavy rework.
solutions: Used structured outputs with confidence scores to guide reviewers instead of guessing.
Tracked every field change and decision in audit logs with role controls.
Separated extraction, validation, and workflow services to scale independently.

qualitative: Reduces manual copy-paste work from PDFs into systems.
Speeds up claim decisions while keeping traceability intact.
Standardizes validation with configurable rules and routing.
